chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Dwayne Brandon Hardwick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate A Vehicle Without Owner's Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Pay restitution in the amount of $200.77 to J.S.  Restitution to be paid first over costs and surcharges.

Pay mandatory costs, fees, surcharges including DNA and restitution during term of probation.  If revoked out of prison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC.  Balance paid during extended supervision.  Any unpaid amount results in a civil judgment.

Full time work, school or a combination.
Obtain GED/HSED.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176 the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and voting.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No illegal drugs and no alcohol.
No contact with J.S.
No further violations of the law.
No driving without a valid drivers license.
Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation.
AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: STAYED to be used at discretion of probation agent.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate A Vehicle Without Owner's Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dwayne Brandon Hardwick

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment

Defendant Dwayne Brandon Hardwick in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Dwayne Brandon Hardwick in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 
The court sentenced the defendant to a maximum term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 3.5 years, credit for 133 day time served, the term of initial confinement is 1.5 years, the term of extended supervision is 2 years. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation for 3 years.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision
- Serve 6 months in the House of Correction as a condition time sentence, STAYED, to be used at discretion of Probation Agent.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no illegal drugs and no alcohol.
- Full time work, school or a combination. 
- Obtain GED/HSED. 
- 50 hours of community service.
- No contact with JS. 
- No further violations of the law.
- Cooperate with agent.
- No driving without a valid driver's license.  
- Pay restitution in the amount of $200.77 to JS, restitution to be paid first over costs and surcharges. 
- Pay mandatory costs, fees, surcharges, including DNA, and restitution, during term of probation. If revoked, out of prison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC, balance paid during extended supervision. Any unpaid amount results in a civil judgment. 

Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Jury Instructions 1465

Attorney Jason A Findling in court, defendant Dwayne Brandon Hardwick not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
PER JUDGES ORDERS; Court ordered case but added to Judge Childs calendar for the next court date.

Defendant Dwayne Brandon Hardwick in court with Attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Dwayne Brandon Hardwick in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dwayne Brandon Hardwick appeared by video means with Attorney.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Beaver.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jason A Findling in court, defendant Dwayne Brandon Hardwick not in court, in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin for James Griffin.  Parties before the Court for bail hearing.  Statement made.  Court GRANTED request and reduced bail to $2,500.  mn

Defendant Dwayne Brandon Hardwick in court with Student Intern Alyssa Foster under the supervision of attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Dwayne Brandon Hardwick in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: P.O. Isaac King - MPD.  Court adjourns for a continued preliminary hearing only for the issue of consent.  Case adjourned for a Continued Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Defense request to be heard as to bail.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jason A Findling in court by video, defendant Dwayne Brandon Hardwick not in court, in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Due to court congestion Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with JS (the owner of the Kia Sprottage) EB the man you known as "Lil E" and anyone known to you with the "Kia Boys", filed.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Dwayne Brandon Hardwick in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Dwayne Brandon Hardwick in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
